intro: Houstonia butterwickiae, commonly known as the buttercup bluemont, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, showy blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, acidic soils and is often found in woodland habitats. It has delicate, hairy leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
